description: The National Statistics Office (NSO) has released findings from the Comprehensive Modular Survey: Education (CMS:E) 2025, highlighting gender-wise differences in education expenditure across India. The survey shows that boys' education expenses are consistently higher than girls' in both rural and urban areas, covering government and private schools. Spending on tuition fees, uniforms, transport, textbooks, and private coaching was examined, with urban averages significantly higher. The report provides detailed comparisons by level of enrolment and type of school.

6.0 magnitude earthquake rocks Afghanistan: At least 20 killed; tremors felt in Pakistan
description: A 6.0-magnitude earthquake struck eastern Afghanistan near the Pakistan border, resulting in over 20 fatalities. More than 115 injured individuals have been hospitalized in Nangarhar and Kunar provinces. The shallow quake, followed by aftershocks, shook buildings across the region, with tremors felt as far as Islamabad. The incident occurred shortly after Nangarhar province experienced devastating floods, compounding the region's challenges.

This act sparked outrage, leading to calls for boycotts of his company and highlighting the impact of public behavior in the digital age.

Citizenship promise: An entire country is shifting to Australia; first agreement of its kind
description: Nearly 9,000 Tuvalu citizens, representing 82% of the population, have applied for Australia's new climate visa program, a key part of the Falepili Union pact. This initiative aims to provide a pathway for mobility as rising sea levels threaten Tuvalu's habitability. The agreement also commits Australia to defend Tuvalu and gives them a say in its defense pacts.

title: Career advice in tech era: Google cofounder to youngsters; embrace tech to be ‘more lazy’
description: Larry Page advised University of Michigan graduates in 2009 to leverage technology for efficiency, citing Google's scalable impact as an example. He emphasized that a small team can create software used by millions, contrasting it with the limitations of manual labor. Page's philosophy propelled Google from a startup to a $2.3 trillion tech giant.

title: Ghaziabad: 30 vehicles break down after refueling at Morta pump
description: Around 30 vehicle owners in Ghaziabad have filed a police complaint, alleging that their cars broke down shortly after refueling at a Bajaj HP station in Morta between August 26 and 29. Customers suspect adulterated diesel caused engine problems, potentially leading to repair costs as high as Rs 3.5 lakh per vehicle.

title: Chargers vs Chiefs YouTube coverage: ESPN bans Jason Kelce
description: YouTube's pursuit of Jason Kelce for its exclusive Chargers-Chiefs broadcast in Brazil was thwarted by ESPN. Kelce, now an ESPN analyst, is restricted from appearing on competitor platforms like YouTube due to a new company policy. This decision marks a shift from last season, as ESPN tightens control over its on-air talent amid the rise of streaming in live sports.

title: AI restructure at Meta: Alexandr Wang’s memo to staff; one thing is clear—All report to him
description: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg is intensifying the AI race by reorganizing Meta Superintelligence Labs (MSL) into four specialized teams under Alexandr Wang's leadership. This restructuring aims to accelerate the pursuit of "personal superintelligence," consolidating research, product development, and infrastructure efforts. Key leaders like Nat Friedman and Aparna Ramani will play crucial roles in this ambitious endeavor.
